definition: nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: If the clouds come down there's no way out.
sentences.chinese: 如果乌云压下来就会无路可走了。

sentences.english: When the "king" of one side has no way out, then it is "checkmated".
sentences.chinese: 当一方的“王”无路可走时，成为被“将死”。

sentences.english: Sometimes goodbye is the only way.
sentences.chinese: 缜有时候，除了说再见，无路可走。

sentences.english: When faced with impasse, wriggling through the middle does not have to be dishonourable.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼前无路可走，选择从中间悄然而过也并不可耻。

sentences.english: Others take the road to let others gave no way out!
sentences.chinese: 一部分人拦着路让其他人无路可走。

sentences.english: We'll be blocked if the dark clouds fall downwards.
sentences.chinese: 如果乌云压下来就会无路可走了。

sentences.english: There is no captive audience online.
sentences.chinese: 网上没有无路可走的受众。
无路可走的受众都死光了。

sentences.english: Driven to desperation, my grandfather hanged himself on a tree beside our ancestral graves.
sentences.chinese: 被逼得无路可走，我祖父在祖坟旁的一棵树上吊死了。

sentences.english: If the clouds cover, there will be no way to walk.
sentences.chinese: 如果乌云压下来就会无路可走了。

sentences.english: Without a captive audience, there's no such thing as "advertising" any more.
sentences.chinese: 没有无路可走的受众，就再也没有所谓的“广告”了。

definition: to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
lit. there is no road to the sky, nor door into the earth (idiom)/fig. to be at the end of one's rope/to be trapped in a hopeless situation
pinyin: shang4 tian1 wu2 lu4 , ru4 di4 wu2 men2

definition: no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
to have no alternative (idiom)
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
this road is blocked/fig. This method does not work./Doing this is no good.
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
nowhere to hide
to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course
pinyin: yi1 tiao2 dao4 zou3 dao4 hei1

definition: unable to move a single step (idiom)/to be in an (extremely) difficult situation
dead end/blind alley
the road back to where one came from
